turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Mr. Galvin's...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Let me talk to Mickey.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Hello, I'm calling from...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: If you're selling something, I'm late for work...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I'm calling from Professional Nurse Quarterly...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: From the magazine?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: This is Mr. Wallace in Subscriptions?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: How come you're calling me from...?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: This is Miss Costello...?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yes. Price...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Pardon?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Kathy Price.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: We find that your subscription lapsed...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: My subscription lapsed three years ago...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: That's why I'm calling, Miss Price...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Missus...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: We have a renew-your-subscription offer...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: We get it at work. We get the magazine at work.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Yes, we know that you do. I have it in my files. That's at the Manhattan Health Center...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: No. At Chelsea Childcare. Okay. Look, call me Monday, hey? I'm late for work.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I'm Joe Galvin, I'm representing Deborah Ann Kaye, case against St. Catherine Laboure.

turns.speaker: MARY ROONEY
turns.text: I told the guy I didn't want to talk to...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I'll just take a minute. Deborah Ann Kaye. You know what I'm talking about. The case is going to trial. Our chief witness is a Dr. David Gruber, you know who he is?

turns.speaker: MARY ROONEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: He's the Assistant Chief of Anesthesiology, Massachusetts Commonwealth. He says your doctors, Towler and Marx, put my girl in the hospital for life. And we can prove that. What we don't know is why. What went on in there? In the O.R. That's what we'd like to know. Something went wrong. And you know what it was. They gave her the wrong anesthetic. What happened? The phone rang... someone got distracted... what?

turns.speaker: MARY ROONEY
turns.text: ...you got your doctor's testimony. Why do you need me?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I want someone who was in the O.R. We're going to win the case, there's no question of that. It's just a matter of how big...

turns.speaker: MARY ROONEY
turns.text: I've got nothing to say to you.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: You know what happened.

turns.speaker: MARY ROONEY
turns.text: Nothing happened.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Then why aren't you testifying for their side?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I can subpoena you, you know. I can get you up there on the stand.

turns.speaker: MARY ROONEY
turns.text: And ask me what?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Who put my client in the hospital for life.

turns.speaker: MARY ROONEY
turns.text: I didn't do it, Mister.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Who are you protecting, then?

turns.speaker: MARY ROONEY
turns.text: Who says that I'm protecting anyone?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I do. Who is it? The Doctors. What do you owe them?

turns.speaker: MARY ROONEY
turns.text: I don't owe them a goddamn thing.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Then why don't you testify?

turns.speaker: MARY ROONEY
turns.text: You know, you're pushy, fella...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: You think I'm pushy now, wait 'til I get you on the stand...

turns.speaker: MARY ROONEY
turns.text: Well, maybe you better do that, then.  You know you guys are all the same. You don't care who gets hurt. You're a bunch of whores. You'd do anything for a dollar. You got no loyalty... no nothing... you're a bunch of whores.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I'm... Mrs. Doneghy? I'm Frank Galvin... why didn't you go in?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: It's locked.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: It's locked?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: It's not a good case. It's a very good case.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: A healthy young woman goes into the hospital to deliver her third child, she's given the wrong anesthetic...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: ...we, we love her, Dick and me...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...I'm sure you do...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: But what can we do? She don't know who's visiting her...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...I know. I went...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: ...You saw her?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Yes. Yes, I have.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You know how beautiful she was?  Her husband left her, and he took her kids... They, they, they'd let you die in there. They don't care. Nobody cares. The Patriot Home, the Chronic Care... in Arlington...? They'd take her in. Perpetual care. They'd take her. Fifty thousand dollars they want. An endowment.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...fifty thousand dollars?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I don't want to leave her. Dick... the, the... and Father Laughlin, he said that it was God's will...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...I understand...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: My doctor told me that I got to move out West... that's when we filed in court. We didn't want to sue...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...I understand...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: ...But Dick, he's looking for two years in Tucson... and they called him up and said to come out. He's a good man. He's only trying to do what's right.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: He saw her at the Northern Care...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...and I have inquiries out to doctors, experts in the field... there is, of course, a problem getting a doctor to testify that another doctor's negligent...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: We just can't do it anymore.  This is our chance to get away.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I'm going to see you get that chance.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What does it mean?  I... I mean we, you have other tactics...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: We, yes. Yes. They, they present their side, and I get the same chance. To cross-examine... to... to...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Are we going to win?  We have, you know, other tactics, though...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Dr. Gruber.

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: Dr. Gruber's not in.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I had an appointment at his office, I think I must have got it wrong. We had a meeting...

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: He's not in, Sir.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I... please. My wife... my wife's prescription has run out. If I can call him...

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: Dr. Halpern's taking all his...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: No, no, no. I have to talk to him. If I can only call him...

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: He's... you can't reach him, Sir. He's in the, on some island in the Caribbean, they don't have a phone.  He'll be back in a week...  If you'd like Dr. Halpern's number...

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Another, Frank...?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...everybody. Mike says, 'Pat, you mean to tell me for a buck you get a free lunch and a beer, and then you go in the back and get laid?' 'That's correct.' Mike says, 'Pat. Have you been in this bar ?' Pat says, 'No, but my sister has...'  Everyone. Buy yourself one too.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I want to buy you a drink.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Thanks, Franky.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Well, well, well. Huh?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: It's a long road that has no turning.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: That's for sure, Frank.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Hi, Mickey...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What the hell do you think you're doing...?  What's going on here...?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Uh...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Fuck you. I got a call today from Sally Doneghy...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...now who is that...?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...You're 'sposed to be in court in ten days and she's telling me you haven't even met with them...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Sally Doneghy, now who is that?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: One lousy letter eighteen months ago... I try to throw a fuckin' case your way...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...hey, I don't need your charity...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...I get these people to trust you -- they're coming here tomorrow by the way -- I get this expert doctor to talk to you. I'm doing all your fuckin' legwork -- and it's eighteen months. You're 'sposed to be in court. I bet you haven't even seen the file.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I have to talk to you.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Come on. Let's get a drink.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Don't touch anything.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Are you out of your mind...?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...I'm going to need your help...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You need my help...? You need a goddamn keeper... are you telling me that you turned down two-hundred-ten grand?  Huh...? Are you nuts? Eh? Are you nuts. What are you going to do, bring her back to life?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I'm going to help her.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: To do what...? To do what, for chrissake...? To help her to do what? She's dead...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: They killed her. And they're trying to buy it...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: That's the point, you stupid fuck. Let them buy it. We let them buy the case. That's what I took it for. You let this drop -- we'll go up to New Hampshire, kill some fuckin' deer...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Mick. Mick. Mick...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: You -- Listen: you said to me, 'if not now, when...'

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I know what I said but not now. You won it. Franky. You won it. When they give you the money, that means that you won. We don't want to go to court -- is this getting to you...?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...he's a good man...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...he's a good man...? He's the Prince of Fuckin' Darkness... he'll have people in there testifying that the broad is well -- they saw her Tuesday on a surfboard at Hyannis... don't fuck with this case.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...I have to stand up for her...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Frank, but not now. Frank. You're trying to wipe out some old business. But not now. I understand. But you go call 'em back. You call the Bishop back.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I have to try this case. I have to do it, Mick. I've got to stand up for that girl. I need your help.  Mick, will you help me...?  Will you help me...?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Who have we got?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: We've got her sister. Testifies she had a meal one hour before she was admitted to the hospital. This is the point.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You got the admittance form says patient ate nine hours prior to admittance.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Admittance form is wrong.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Forget it. You can't prove it. Sister's testimony is no good. Jury knows we win she gets the cash.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I've got my Dr. Gruber, says her heart condition means they gave her the wrong anesthetic anyway, plus she came in complaining of stomach pains...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...Gruber's not bad.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Not bad...? This guy's Dr. Kildare, the jury's going to love him, Mick... And you calm down, all right? Their guy, Towler's, the author of the book,  'Methodology and Practice, Anesthesiology.'  ...and they got depositions from the nurses, everybody in the operating room, the scrub-nurse... 'All these guys are God. I saw them walk on water...'  They had an obstetrical nurse in there. We got a deposition from the obstetrical nurse?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: 'Mary Rooney, forty-nine. Lives in Arlington, still working at the hospital.' Can you get out tomorrow? How come she isn't speaking up.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Okay now. Cases: Smith versus State of Michigan.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Brindisi versus Electric Boat.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You got a good memory, Franky.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I had a good teacher. McLean versus Urban Transport...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Jimmy? Bushmills.  Lookit, do me a favor. I'll buy you a drink tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah? And what are you going to do tonight?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I'm going to get laid.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Been a long time, huh...?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I'm getting it back. Don't worry about me, Mick. I'm fine. D'you find the obstetric nurse?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Mary Rooney. She won't talk to me. I tried her at the hospital. I'm going to try her back at home. Read this.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: So what...? The best is yet to come. Check the TV Guide. They got our Dr. Towler on a panel on GBH on Friday: 'The Healing Hand. The Experts Speak.'

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: They still have to take it to a jury.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What I'm saying, they're getting some help.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: So what do you want me to do? Concannon's going to try the case his way, I'm going to try it mine. You want me to go wee wee wee all the time because he's got some flack, got stories in the newspaper. I'm going to win this case.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: John: gimme a cuesta-ray.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Oh shit, what's today?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Today is Tuesday. What?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I've got to go see Gruber.  What's the best cigars you have?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Give 'em a box of Macanudos.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Mickey: I'm supposed to meet somebody at O'Rourke's, I can't make it.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What happened, Joey...?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I can't talk now.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: D'you meet with Dr. Gruber...?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah? How's our new witness?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: D'you find the obstetric nurse?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: She's workin' the late shift at the Hospital. She's at home now, I'm going over there to talk to...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Gimme the address. I'm gonna go. We're going to need her.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: How are you holding up?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I'm swell.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: And all we've got is a witch doctor!

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Okay. What do you do when you don't have a witness?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You use their witness.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I think we tried that. The case is over.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Are you with me... are you awake...?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah. I'm awake.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Rooney's protecting someone. Who is she protecting?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: The Doctors.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: She's protecting the Doctors she'd be up there on the stand...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Read me what she said.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: 'You guys are a bunch of whores... uh... loyalty... you don't care who gets hurt... you don't have any loyalty...'

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...one of the other nurses?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Who? They're all testifying. Everybody who was in the O.R.'s going to take the stand.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: All right. Who wasn't in the O.R.?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: What difference can that make...? All right...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Uh... the admitting nurse...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What did she do?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: She didn't do anything. She took the patient's history and signed the charts. 'K.C.'  'Kathy Costello...'

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: The 'History'...?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: How old are you, how many children... when did you last eat...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: We don't have anything from the Nurse Association?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: The broad has disappeared...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: The Hospital...?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...yeah... good...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...you need some old forms that she had... somebody's dying...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...four years ago...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Hello. This is Mr. Dorchester in Records. We're looking for Kathy Costello...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I need a cigarette!  She left my office four years ago, we're looking for a chart...  I need a cigarette...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: What the hell are you doing here?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: We got to talk.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: What are you doing in New York...?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Come on, we'll get a cup of coffee...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I talked to Johnnie White at the Bar Association.  The broad used to work for one of Concannon's partners in New York awhile ago.  She wanted to move to Boston.  How badly did she hurt us, Joe?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: We got a mistrial, you know. Joe -- did you hear what I said...?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I don't want a mistrial.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I spoke to her, and everything is all right.

turns.speaker: ROONEY
turns.text: I, what are you talking about? I talked to her this morning, and she said...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: She told me.

turns.speaker: ROONEY
turns.text: She did?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: I just saw her.

turns.speaker: ROONEY
turns.text: In New York?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ROONEY
turns.text: You saw Kat in New York...  ...or is she in town? Is she in town...?

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Dr. Towler...

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: You have a record of what happened in the operating room...

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: Yes, that's correct.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...there are notations every thirty seconds...

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...of the procedures...

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: Yes, the roving nurse...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: But those notations stop...  ...Four-and-one-half minutes after Deborah Ann Kaye's...

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: We, we were rather busy...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Four-and-one-half minutes after her heart stopped.  And they resume seven minutes...

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: As I've said we had some more...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: ...they start again three minutes earlier...

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: We had rather more important things on our mind than taking notes.  We were trying to restore her...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: What happened in those three...

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: ...we were trying to restore her heartbeat.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: What happened in those three minutes...?

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: We'd gone to 'Code Blue,' we were administering electro...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Why did it take that long to get her heartbeat...

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: Brain damage could have been... it didn't necessarily take nine minutes, it could have been caused in two...

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Wait, wait, wait, you're saying that her brain damage could have been caused by her being deprived of oxygen for two minutes...?

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GALVIN
turns.text: Huh. And why is that?

turns.speaker: TOWLER
turns.text: Because she was anemic.  It's right there on her chart. Her brain was getting less oxygen anyway...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Franky can't make it. He had an appointment he forgot, he's going to see you later. I'm Mickey Morrissey, we're supposed to get to know each other.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: How'm I doing so far?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: So far you're great. You got a cigarette?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Stearns, Harrington, you know who that is?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Should I?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: A huge law firm. Okay? They put him in the firm, he's married, everything's superb. Franky, he's starting to talk like he comes from Dorsetshire, some fuckin' place, 'You must drop by with Pat and me...' Okay...?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...and he's making a billion dollars every minute working for Stearns, Harrington, and he bought a dog, and everything is rosy.  Then Mr. Stearns, he tried to fix a case.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: The Big Boy did...?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: That Frank was working on. Yeah. He thought Franky needed some help, so they bribed a juror. So Franky finds out. He comes to me in tears. He thinks that anybody who knows what a 'spinnaker' is got to be a saint. I told him 'Franky, wake up. These people are sharks. What do you think they got so rich from? Doing good?' He can't be comforted. He tells the boys at Stearns and Harrington they've disappointed him, he's going to the Judge to rat them out.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Huh.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Before he can get there here comes this Federal Marshal, and Franky's indicted for Jury tampering, they throw him in jail, he's gonna be disbarred, his life is over.  Jimmy, gimme another drink.  How are you?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Me, too.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Okay. Now, so he's in jail. He, finally, he gets to see the light, he calls up Harrington, he says he thinks he made a mistake. As if by magic, charges against him are dropped, he's released from jail.  P.S. He's fired from the firm, his wife divorces him, he turns to drink and mopes around three and a half years.  You like that story?

turns.speaker: ALONZO HOGUE
turns.text: Looks almost cold now, don't it?

turns.speaker: WASH PERRY
turns.text: That won't start no more fires.  We might's well go home.

turns.speaker: ALONZO HOGUE
turns.text: Yeah.  No sense stayin' out here.

turns.speaker: WASH PERRY
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: WASH PERRY
turns.text: It's an enemy sneak attack.  Let's get outta here!

turns.speaker: ALONZO HOGUE
turns.text: Wait a minute - wait a minute!.... Bombs don't unscrew.

turns.speaker: WASH PERRY
turns.text: It's no meteor, that's for sure!

turns.speaker: ALONZO HOGUE
turns.text: Darnedest thing I ever saw - the way that's unscrewing!

turns.speaker: WASH PERRY
turns.text: We'd be the first to make contact with 'em -- see?

turns.speaker: ALONZO HOGUE
turns.text: We'd be in all the papers!

turns.speaker: WASH PERRY
turns.text: Hey, how about that!

turns.speaker: ALONZO HOGUE
turns.text: We could show 'em we're friendly, huh?  Walk out there with a white flag!  Here - I got an old sugar sack in my car!

turns.speaker: WASH PERRY
turns.text: Hey, there - open up!

turns.speaker: ALONZO HOGUE
turns.text: Come on out!  We're friends!

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: That explains why communication is cut the moment their machines begin to move.

turns.speaker: CHIEF OF STAFF
turns.text: Madrid has just blacked out!! Nothing more coming through.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: The same thing that happened on our Pacific Coast.  Anything from them yet?

turns.speaker: CHIEF OF STAFF
turns.text: Mister Secretary - if they link up with those others near Fresno...

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: All right - I've seen enough!

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: There's only one thing that will stop the Martians!  We've held back pre- viously because of the danger of radiation to civilians.  Now there's no choice.  The United Nations has voted authority to the United States.  The White House will confirm an order to use the Atom bomb.

turns.speaker: CHIEF OF STAFF
turns.text: Then our first target will be the initial landing place outside Los Angeles.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: I'll request the scientists from Pacific-Tech to monitor the drop.  We'll clear the area all around.  After that we'll hit them all over the world. I'll have long-range bombers alerted, loaded and standing by.

turns.speaker: M.P. DRIVER
turns.text: Hey, you!  Better get outa here!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I'm looking for some Pacific-Tech professors...

turns.speaker: M.P. DRIVER
turns.text: There's nobody left around here now.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: We had a chance...We could have stopped them!  The mob stole the trucks and smashed everything up.  The fools!  They cut their own throats!

turns.speaker: M.P. DRIVER
turns.text: Hurry up!  Jump in!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: There was a girl with them...If I could find her....

turns.speaker: M.P. DRIVER
turns.text: You look kinda lost yourself.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: But I think I know where she'll be....

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Is that it over there?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Yes...ugly looking, isn't it.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Did you see it come down?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Yes...I was fishing up in the hills.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: You must have caught plenty with all that tackle!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Oh - there were three of us.  The others flew back in my plane.  I don't understand why a meteor this size didn't make a bigger crater.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: It hit sideways and skidded in.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: What's that fellow over there trying to do - dig it out?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: He's top man in astro and nuclear physics.  He knows all about meteors!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: You seem to know a lot about him.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Well, I did a thesis on modern scien- tists - working for my Masters degree.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Did it do you any good?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Why, sure -- I got it!  Do you have a match?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I don't smoke.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Forrester's the man behind the new atomic engines.  They had him on the cover of 'Time'.  You've got to rate to get that!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Aw, he isn't that good...!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: How can you say that when you don't know him!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I do know him...slightly.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: What's he like?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Like...ah...

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Well, you certainly don't look like yourself in that get-up!  But I am happy to meet you anyway. I'm Sylvia Van Buren.  I teach Library Science over at USC.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I didn't know how to stop you...!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I might have recognized you without the beard.  And you didn't wear glasses on the 'Time' cover!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: They're really for long distance. When I want to look at something close...  I take them off.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: They've all stopped at the same time.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: There's only about one explanation for a thing like this..Got a pin?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: How does it happen cars are running?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Automobile ignitions are insulated.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: The troops are certainly moving in here!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Didn't you have something to do with this?  I know you sent word to the Sixth Army Command!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I just told them the local situation. Colonel Heffner's in full charge now.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: You never know where you're going to wind up when you go to a square dance!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Good to see you, General.  This is Pastor Collins, director of Civil Defense.  Sheriff Bogany, head of the local forces ... Miss Van Buren.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Would you like some coffee, General?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: We can't go into town - everybody's getting out of there!  I'll fly you over to Pasadena.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Can you handle one of these?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Sure...get in!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: You'll hit something!  Can't you go higher?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: No.  The air's going to be full of Jets in a minute...And there they are!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I never noticed before - that's a cowboy tie....

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I bought it for the square dance. I thought I ought to wear some- thing Western.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Is that... machine...?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: It's gone now.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Where are we?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Southwest of Corona, somewhere. There must have been another cylinder down here.  They've been through this whole area and cleared everybody out.  There's a farmhouse.  Let's see if we can find something to eat...!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I almost forget when I ate last.  It looks so good.... You know, mostly I get my meals in coffee shops and restaurants.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Don't you live at home?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: No, on the campus.  I haven't any family.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I come from a big one.  Nine of us. All in Minnesota, except me.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I have no close folks.  My parents died when I was a kid.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: A big family must be fun...I imagine it makes you feel you belong to something.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: It does...Maybe that's why I feel kind of lost right now.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: We'll get safely out of here, don't worry.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: But they seem to murder everything that moves...!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: If they're mortal, they must have mortal weaknesses.  They'll be stopped -- somehow!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I've been as close to them as anyone. But not close enough for real observation...

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I feel like I did one time when I was small.  Awful scared and lonesome...I'd wandered off - I've forgotten why - but the family and whole crowds of neighbors were hunting for me.  They found me in a church.  I was afraid to go in any place else.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I stayed right by the door - praying for the one who loved me best to come and find me.  It was Uncle Matthew who found me.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I liked him.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: He liked you ... I could bawl my head off!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: But you're not going to.  You're not the kind.  You're tired, anyway.  You've been up all night.  You cracked up in a plane.  Slept in a ditch.  But you want to know something?  It doesn't show on you at all.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: How long was I out?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Hours.  I've been so scared...!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Nothing there now.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: It was...  ...one of them!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: What was it like?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I couldn't see much in the dark - but it was one!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: We're right in a nest of 'em! ... I've got to get a look at them.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Maybe they aren't too sure we're here.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: They could be as curious about us as we are about them.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Maybe ...  Maybe they want to take us alive.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: They've blocked it!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: It's blocked here, too!  They've pushed up earth or something all around outside.  Here, this way...!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Is it possible to go in right after the explosion?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Yes, with these suits.  We've used them before on atomic tests... Odd- looking, aren't they?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Very futuristic.  Yours doesn't really go with that butch haircut!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I could wear it longer -- but it's less trouble this way.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: My kid brother has one.  You know why?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Yes ...  Fits better in a football helmet.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: How'd you guess?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: That's the kind of a kid brother you'd have!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: The Rockies...!  You'd rather get back to that big family of yours in Minnesota, wouldn't you?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I wonder if they're going through this too...?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I probably wouldn't be able to get to them if I tried...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: You'll be all right with us....  ...for as long as anybody's got!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Don't let's lose each other.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: That's what knocked the phones out, too.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: How could it happen to everybody's watch together?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Have you got a pocket compass?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: That needle ain't pointing north!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: It's pointing out to the gully - where that meteor came down.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: What is that gizmo?!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I think that - gizmo - is a machine from another planet.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: We better get word to the authorities and --  Look!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: This Martian blood...  Let's make a quick analysis and see what we've got!

turns.speaker: GRATZMAN
turns.text: It might give us something.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: A forlorn hope - but there is a chance.

turns.speaker: GRATZMAN
turns.text: It might give us time to search out some weakness in the Martians.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I believe we can get a lead from their anaemic blood.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: We know now that we can't beat their machines -- but we can beat them!  They are mortal beings...The only question is whether we have time enough to do anything!

turns.speaker: GRATZMAN
turns.text: If we get what transportation we can, and pick up instruments and books from Pacific-Tech...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Gratzman! -- Gratzman!  Did you get those biotics?

turns.speaker: GRATZMAN
turns.text: No.  I thought you had them.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: All right.  I'll get them!   Go ahead - go ahead!  I'll catch up with you.

turns.speaker: FIDDLER
turns.text: I got a message for you.  You're the guys from Pacific-Tech, ain't you?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: FIDDLER
turns.text: Looks like the fishing was good.

turns.speaker: FIDDLER
turns.text: It's about that meteor.  They say it's a whopper.  The District Officer phoned us at the lookout up on the summit. Thought you might be interested... It's ten or twelve miles from here - over by Linda Rosa.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Are they sure it's a meteor?  It didn't come down like one.

turns.speaker: FIDDLER
turns.text: That's right - came down in kinda spurts, didn't it?  You fellers'll have to figure it out.  You're scientists  All I know - they say it's as big as a house and practically red hot.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I'd like to borrow your car and take a look at it in the morning.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: There's one - there's the other, and we're right between them!

turns.speaker: PASTOR COLLINS
turns.text: So is the town, I notice!

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: I warned you Civil Defense people to be ready if you have to evacuate.

turns.speaker: PASTOR COLLINS
turns.text: I just came to tell you - everyone has been alerted.

turns.speaker: PASTOR COLLINS
turns.text: Colonel - shooting's no good!

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: It's always been a good persuader.

turns.speaker: PASTOR COLLINS
turns.text: Couldn't you try to communicate with them first - and shoot later if you have to?

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: General Mann -- I was told to expect you, sir.  I'm Colonel Heffner.

turns.speaker: GENERAL MANN
turns.text: I'm here to make up a report, not to interfere with the operations you've set up.  You're still in command.  Clayton Forrester!  I haven't seen you since Oak Ridge.

turns.speaker: GENERAL MANN
turns.text: That's their position?  You've certainly got them surrounded.  I suppose they've neutralized all communications here.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: Not all.  Radio is out.  But our field phones are okay so far.

turns.speaker: GENERAL MANN
turns.text: And they'll go out the minute there's another ray.  A cylinder reported down by Huntington Beach.  That's a job for the Navy.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: We will, sir!

turns.speaker: GENERAL MANN
turns.text: From the data - and from that picture the Air Force took earlier tonight ...  ... what we've got in the gully out there is a guide ship.  One lands ... Others follow later.  They appear to clear an area, then drop in groups of threes, joined magnetically.  Is that possible?

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: My orders are not to go into action unless they make a move out of there.

turns.speaker: GENERAL MANN
turns.text: That's because we want a chance to observe them.  This is the only place we've had time to surround them with sufficient force to contain them.  What happens here will be a guide to all other operations. The minute action begins and a pattern of defense develops, I'll get my report to Washington.  You've deployed your forces well.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: Thank you, sir.  If they start anything, we can blast them right off the earth!

turns.speaker: GENERAL MANN
turns.text: They'll probably move at dawn.

turns.speaker: PASTOR COLLINS
turns.text: That probably dropped half way to Pomona!...What do you think?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: It was nearer than that.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Uncle Matthew...this is Dr. Clayton Forrester.  My uncle - Dr. Matthew Collins, pastor of the Community Church.

turns.speaker: PASTOR COLLINS
turns.text: Well-l...how do you do, Dr. Forrester!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: They don't do much of anything...!

turns.speaker: PASTOR COLLINS
turns.text: There's a square dance at the social hall this evening.

turns.speaker: PASTOR COLLINS
turns.text: They are living creatures out there.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: But they're not human!  Dr. Forrester says they're some kind of an advanced civilization --

turns.speaker: PASTOR COLLINS
turns.text: If they're more advanced than us, they should be nearer the Creator for that reason!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Let's go back inside, Uncle Matthew.

turns.speaker: PASTOR COLLINS
turns.text: I've done about all I can do here. You go back in.  Sylvia - I like that Doctor Forrester.  He's a good man.
